title: 36 lakh school kits, sans political branding, distributed to students in State
content: Named Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan Vidyarthi Mithra Kits, they have undergone a three-stage quality check before distribution, and cost govt. ₹953.71 crore

title: No immediate danger to Srisailam dam gates, says expert
content: Stating that leakage is less than 10% from gate No. 10, A.P. Govt. Advisor Kannaiah Naidu suggests repair and repainting of gates and proper maintenance to extend their life

title: Palakkad, Malappuram administrations step up vigil against Nipah
content: 383 persons in the State are under observation, says Health Minister. Additional ICU and isolation facilities set up in Palakkad, Malappuram and Kozhikode to prepare for a potential surge in patients

title: Rayaraddi says media distorted his remarks on guarantee schemes, infrastructure funding
content: This comes after he indicated that the govt. is facing difficulty in funding infrastructure projects due to the large outlay for guarantee schemes

title: Environment impact study for Great Nicobar project downplays earthquake risk
content: Report says the probability of another mega earthquake, such as the one that led to the 2004 tsunami, is ‘low’; however, an IIT-Kanpur report had pointed to uncertainty in ‘prediction of future earthquakes’; professor who led the IIT study urges infra planners to conduct ‘site-specific study’

title: CPI(M) directs rank and file to defend Veena George
content: Directive comes in the wake of some party members in the Health Minister’s home district, Pathanamthitta, criticising the Minister’s style of functioning on social media. The Minister is at the centre of a political storm after a building collapse at MCH killed a caregiver

title: Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy heading to Delhi to push for early clearances of pending projects
content: He is likely to invite Rahul Gandhi for the launch of distribution of new ration cards at Tungaturthy in Suryapet district

title: Devotees throng Swarnala Cheruvu on first day of ‘Rottela Panduga’
content: Over 15 lakh devotees are expected to visit Bara Shaheed Dargah to exchange ‘roti’ during the five-day festival

title: Police form Eluru Disaster Response Force amid rising Godavari flood levels
content: The newly-formed force comprises police personnel from various cadres trained in flood rescue techniques, including operations in canals, streams and the Godavari, says the SP

title: Justice Chandrachud clarifies extended stay at official residence not indefinite
content: Former CJI cites children’s special needs and lack of accessible housing in Delhi; says he is awaiting completion of allotted government accommodation

title: Geo-tube along Narsapuram coast to be commissioned by October
content: The project funded by Deloitte India, which is offering ₹13.50 crore, will prevent erosion along the coastal stretch of Pedda Mynavarani Lanka (P.M. Lanka) in West Godavari district

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon has been brutal for the top seeds, but Ben Shelton and Emma Navarro are among those who remain in the draw

title: Pavlyuchenkova moves past tech glitch, into last 8
content: Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova overcame a line-calling technology malfunction on a key point en route to defeating Sonay Kartal 7-6 (3), 6-4 on Sunday to make her second Wimbledon quarterfinal nine years after her first appearance.

title: Former White Sox pitcher, world champ Jenks dies
content: Bobby Jenks, 44, a former pitcher for the Chicago White Sox who was on the roster when the club won the 2005 World Series, died Friday in Sintra, Portugal, the team announced, months after being diagnosed with adenocarcinoma, a form of stomach cancer.

title: Irish OL Jagusah fractures arm in UTV accident
content: Notre Dame offensive lineman Charles Jagusah broke his left arm Saturday in a utility task vehicle accident in Wyoming.

title: Rookies Citron, Iriafen among WNBA ASG reserves
content: Rookies Sonia Citron and Kiki Iriafen of the Mystics were among the 12 reserves selected by league coaches for the WNBA All-Star Game on July 19 in Indianapolis

title: Fritz into Wimbledon quarters after Thompson hurt
content: American Taylor Fritz moved into the Wimbledon quarterfinals for the third time in four years on Sunday, advancing when his injured opponent, Jordan Thompson, retired while trailing 6-1, 3-0 after 41 minutes.

title: Bailey shaky in debut, but hustle impresses Jazz
content: Jazz rookie Ace Bailey finished with just eight points in his Salt Lake City Summer League debut, but his willingness to defend and rebound impressed his coaches.

title: Norris wins British GP; Hulkenberg makes podium
content: Lando Norris emerged victorious in a wet and wild British Grand Prix that saw McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri stripped of his chance of victory by a 10-second penalty for a safety car infringement.

title: Irish land WR Fitzgerald, son of ex-NFL star Larry
content: Devin Fitzgerald, a three-star wide receiver and the son of former NFL star Larry Fitzgerald, has committed to Notre Dame.

title: 🏈 Fantasy football sleepers, busts and breakouts
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: What to know about U.S. vs. Mexico: Gold Cup final preview, predictions, more
content: Sunday's Gold Cup final is a reunion for the Concacaf rivals U.S. and Mexico, but who has the edge heading into the festivities at Houston's NRG Stadium? Here's what you need to know.

title: Remembering Ruffian 50 years after her breakdown at Belmont
content: The filly shattered her right front ankle in a match race against Kentucky Derby winner Foolish Pleasure.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: USC Paralympian Ezra Frech is a pioneer under pressure
content: The two-time gold medalist is the first above-the-knee amputee recruited to a D-I track and field program.

title: Angel Reese, Alyssa Thomas and 10 more predicted All-Star reserves
content: Which 12 players could fill out the WNBA All-Star roster? We make some predictions -- and discuss some cuts.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: Gonzalo García proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo García could be the reason they go all the way.

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: PSG passed one of their most difficult tests of the Club World Cup, overcoming two red cards in 2-0 win over Bayern Munich.

title: Dortmund coach: MetLife field more suited to golf
content: In the eyes of Borussia Dortmund coach Niko Kovač, the MetLife Stadium field was better suited for a round of golf than a match at the Club World Cup.

title: Müller bids Bayern farewell in loss; future unclear
content: Thomas Müller played his last game for Bayern Munich in a loss to PSG in the quarterfinals of the Club World Cup on Saturday.

title: Mbappé stunner sets up Madrid semi with PSG
content: Real Madrid edged Borussia Dortmund 3-2 in a dramatic Club World Cup quarterfinal Saturday to set up a semifinal against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Poch: U.S. needs 'pressure' of final before '26 WC
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said his team needs the "pressure" Sunday's Gold Cup final against Mexico to prepare for next summer's World Cup.

title: Holders England beaten by France in Euros opener
content: Marie-Antoinette Katoto and Sandy Baltimore scored first-half goals as France beat reigning champions England 2-1 in their Women's Euro Group D opener

title: Neuer criticizes Donnarumma after Musiala injury
content: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer criticized his PSG counterpart Gianluigi Donnarumma after Jamal Musiala suffered an apparent serious injury.

title: Jota funeral: Liverpool squad, family pay respects
content: Family, friends and teammates gathered to pay their respects to Diogo Jota and his brother, André Silva, whose funerals were held Saturday morning.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final
content: Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez has plenty of motivation going into Sunday's Gold Cup final against the United States.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: Belgium's record scorer Wullaert ready to lead from the front vs. Spain
content: Belgium face Spain knowing their Euro 2025 could be over before it begins, but captain and record scorer Tessa Wullaert is used to doing things the hard way.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Leão
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Leão from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gyökeres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Atomic energy board grants operational licence to two home-built 700 MWe reactors in Gujarat
content: The AERB has concluded design and commissioning safety reviews and issued Licence for Operation of Units 3 and 4 of Kakrapar Atomic Power Station

title: Possession of suspected leopard tooth: Union Minister Suresh Gopi to be summoned
content: The Forest department will issue a notice to actor asking him to produce a pendant which he was seen wearing, and appear before the Divisional Forest Officer, Thrissur, to ascertain whether it is a wildlife trophy. Future course of action will be decided after obtaining his statement, says an officer

title: Kerala University Syndicate ‘revokes’ Registrar’s suspension, V-C rejects legality of decision taken after adjournment
content: Registrar K.S. Anil Kumar reassumes responsibilities later in the day following Syndicate’s directions

title: Kerala Tourism courts row after roping in YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra for tourism promotion
content: The YouTuber was part of a media familiarisation trip of the Kerala Tourism held in January. However, when she was selected for this, there were no cases charged against her by any of the enforcement agencies in India

title: LSGD regularises HLL Life Care’s office buildings in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The violations earlier reported included lack of sufficient car parking or two wheeler parking space, insufficient space behind the building and issues related to reuse and recycling of water.

title: No country with 28% poverty can claim to be ‘fourth most equal in the world’: Congress
content: After Centre uses World Bank report to assert claim of low consumption-based inequality, Congress notes that the same report highlights high wage disparity, limitations in comparing consumption data

title: Andhra Pradesh Bar Council seeks mechanism to act on trolling, digital abuse of the judiciary
content: It also recommends formation of a special unit under the supervision of the DGP to monitor, investigate and curb online abuse against judges, and to empower it to take swift and deterrent action against perpetrators

title: Muharram processions conclude peacefully in Kashmir amid concern over ‘detention’ of Shia mourners
content: Shia mourners take out processions; L-G Sinha, Farooq Abdullah, BJP leaders participate; clerics object to police action over banners

title: Devotees turn up in huge numbers at Kanaka Durga temple
content: ‘Sakambari Devi Utsavam’ to be held grandly from July 8 to 10 during the period from ‘Aashada Suddha Trayodasi’ to ‘Pournami’, says temple executive officer

title: We’re encouraging universities, colleges to form Bayalata troupes, says academy chief
content: ‘We are also working to document the lives of artists who have dedicated themselves to Bayalata and collect manuscripts related to the art form’

title: Thirumavalavan expresses regret over his anti-LGBTQ+ comment
content: A video of the incident was shared widely on social media recently and resulted in widespread criticism

title: Catholic Church urges Christian youths to join politics
content: A circular issued by the Youth Commission of the KCBC says Catholic youth organisations should train youngsters with leadership qualities and bring them into mainstream politics

title: YSRCP faults ‘forceful’ acquisition of land from farmers in Prakasam district
content: The government’s approach shows a blatant disregard for farmers’ rights and democratic principles, alleges Merugu Nagarjuna

title: Make elaborate arrangements for mega parents-teachers meeting on July 10, Eluru District Collector tells officials
content: The event should be conducted in a pleasant and welcoming atmosphere, with a strong turnout from students, parents and dignitaries, she says

title: BRS demands govt. to switch motors of all LISs to allow ryots take up Kharif crops early
content: Harish Rao says the BRS would lead ryots to pump houses to switch on motors if the Govt. fails to take up water lifting

title: Children of beggars offered admission in V.R. High School in Nellore
content: The two children, while begging on the streets, expressed their wish to study in school to Municipal Commissioner Y.O. Nandan, who helped them get admission with the support of Education Minister Nara Lokesh

title: Students allege felling of trees at Agri University, but VC says invasive weeds cleared
content: Vice Chancellor says varsity clearing invasive weeds to plant native timber, wild fruit and wild flower bearing tree species

title: Public vigilance crucial in crime control, says police officer
content: Kalaburagi hosts a meaningful event to facilitate dialogue between the police and the public on the rising crime rate

title: NMC brings in new regulations to expand medical education infrastructure, manpower
content: ‘These regulations mark a paradigm shift in how faculty eligibility is determined — shifting the focus from rigid service norms to competency, teaching experience, and academic merit,’ the NMC said in a statement

title: Thiruvananthapuram city Corporation launches project to provide menstrual cups to students
content: The reusable menstrual cups are considered to be a healthy, sustainable and affordable alternative to sanitary napkins, which also leads to generation of waste.

title: BJP government eroding autonomy of Assam tribal councils, says Gaurav Gogoi
content: Congress MP accuses Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of centralising powers, undermining tribal councils

title: Guntur Lok Adalat resolves 1,076 civil cases in a day, sets national benchmark
content: Compensation totalling ₹51 crore was awarded to victims, largely from motor accident claims and civil settlements, says the District Legal Services Authority Chairman

title: Vijay’s TVK scotches speculation on alliance with AIADMK
content: The people of Tamil Nadu are disillusioned with both the DMK and the AIADMK and are looking for a meaningful and credible alternative, says TVK general secretary K.G. Arunraj

title: Bellad urges Centre to deploy e-buses in North Karnataka
content: Fast-growing cities and towns in the region need eco-friendly initiatives, says the Deputy Leader of Opposition in the Assembly

title: Chirag Paswan takes a dig at NDA government led by Nitish Kumar over law and order
content: Chirag Paswan supported the demand for introducing a domicile policy for government jobs in Bihar, becoming the only NDA leader to do so; Nitish Kumar government has already ruled out the possibility of introducing a domicile policy, saying it would be against the Constitution

title: Captain Shubman Gill keeps a piece of history, takes stump after India’s first Edgbaston win
content: India secured a resounding 337-run victory over England in the second Test at Edgbaston, leveling the series 1-1. Shubman Gill, in his maiden Test as captain, celebrated with Akash Deep and Mohammed Siraj, collecting stumps as souvenirs. Akash Deep's stellar 6/99, including a five-wicket haul, dismantled England's batting lineup, who were chasing a daunting 608-run target.

title: Akash Deep: The boy from Sasaram, who made England dance to his tunes at Edgbaston
content: Akash Deep didn’t get his desired conditions in England. Excited to bowl with the Dukes ball on a juicy pitch, he instead replaced Jasprit Bumrah on a placid Edgbaston track, but he adapted and rattled England in both innings. His dismissal of Joe Root in the second innings showcased his class and the hard yards he has put in on flat Indian pitches in the Ranji Trophy.

title: 'Global South is a victim of 'double standards': PM Modi at Brics Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the 17th BRICS Summit in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, emphasizing India's dedication to enhanced collaboration and fair global progress. The summit, which included new member countries, addressed crucial global issues such as multilateralism, artificial intelligence, and economic resilience. PM Modi engaged with fellow leaders, reaffirming BRICS's potential to foster a more inclusive global future.

title: Microsoft 'quits' Pakistan after 25 years; country manager says: This is more than a...
content: Microsoft is set to implement significant layoffs, primarily impacting its sales and marketing division, as part of an ongoing restructuring effort amid substantial AI investments. This move coincides with Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff's planned eight-week sabbatical, scheduled to conclude in September. The layoffs represent the third major workforce reduction this year for the tech giant.

title: Rahul Gandhi's photo on sanitary pad: FIR filed over fake video
content: Congress has strongly condemned the circulation of a fabricated video that misuses Rahul Gandhi's photograph, falsely depicting it on sanitary pad packets distributed under the Priyadarshini Udaan Yojana in Bihar, leading to the filing of an FIR. This controversy arose shortly after Congress initiated a menstrual hygiene campaign in Bihar, distributing sanitary pads to women, with boxes featuring images of Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra to promote awareness.

title: Himachal floods: Congress targets Kangana over ‘don’t have any cabinet’ remark, calls it ‘insensitive’
content: BJP MP Kangana Ranaut faced criticism from the Congress party for her perceived insensitive remarks during a visit to flood-affected areas in her Mandi constituency. The Congress shared a video where Ranaut downplayed disaster relief efforts, stating she lacks an official cabinet.

title: How China tried undermine sales of Rafale after Op Sindoor? French intel reveals
content: French intelligence suggests China deployed embassies to undermine the Rafale fighter jet's reputation following its use in India-Pakistan clashes. Chinese defense attaches allegedly spread doubts among Rafale buyers like Indonesia, promoting Chinese alternatives through social media disinformation.

title: 'President Elon'? Musk launches 'America Party' after spat with Trump - is it viable?
content: Elon Musk has launched the "America Party," aiming to disrupt the two-party system and challenge what he calls a corrupt "uniparty." This move formalizes his growing feud with Trump, as Musk vows to fund challengers to Republican incumbents. Experts are skeptical, citing historical challenges faced by third parties, but acknowledge Musk's potential to reshape the GOP through primary challenges.

title: Poll panel under fire: RJD, TMC take EC to court over SIR in Bihar; call it ‘voter purge’
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has petitioned the Supreme Court against the Election Commission's special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, alleging it disenfranchises millions, particularly migrant and poor voters, at the behest of the BJP. Moitra claims the process violates constitutional provisions and the Representation of People's Act, citing new document requirements that exclude common IDs.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: 'Ball now in US court': India 'draws its red lines'
content: India-US trade deal: India has set its red lines in ongoing trade negotiations with the US, particularly concerning agriculture and dairy sectors, ahead of President Trump's July 9 tariff deadline. The decision on an interim trade deal now rests with America. India seeks complete exemption from the 26% tariffs.

title: Gamble! Jadeja's under-100-second trick traps England captain at Edgbaston
content: India strategically utilised Ravindra Jadeja's quick over before lunch, enabling Washington Sundar to dismiss Ben Stokes with the final ball. Akash Deep's impressive spell with the new ball rattled England early on Day 5, exploiting seam movement and claiming crucial wickets.

title: Why Bilawal Bhutto's Masood, Hafiz extradition offer is a sham - no power, no trust
content: Amid strained relations, Pakistan's former foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari surprisingly offered to extradite wanted terrorists if India cooperates legally. This comes after India put the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, a crucial resource for Pakistan. Experts view Bhutto's statement with skepticism, citing Pakistan's history of betrayals and Bhutto's lack of executive authority.

title: Savannah James daughter Zhuri’s lavish bedroom: makes hilarious parenting claim
content: Savannah James shared a glimpse into her daughter Zhuri's lavishly decorated room on Instagram, humorously revealing that Zhuri never actually sleeps there. The video captured Zhuri's playful bedtime routine, which included climbing on her bed's wooden structure, prompting a lighthearted exchange with her mother. Amidst family changes, Savannah balances her roles, prioritizing family life and advocating for self-care.

title: Russell Wilson’s wife Ciara celebrates: backs his Marvel debut
content: Ciara supports Russell Wilson as his clothing label, 3BRAND, appears in Marvel's Ironheart. The brand made its TV debut in the Disney+ series. Wilson shared his excitement on social media. Ciara also expressed her pride. 3BRAND's appearance raises its profile in fashion and entertainment. The couple's business bond continues to grow. Their influence has now reached a global superhero stage.

title: Larsa Pippen drops massive update about her big day with new beau Jeff Coby
content: Larsa Pippen, Scottie Pippen's ex-wife, has revealed details about her relationship with Jeff Coby, a professional basketball player. She shared that they are on a positive path and hinted at engagement plans, discussing her preferred diamond cuts. Larsa was particularly touched by Coby's family-oriented nature, citing an instance where he was teaching his niece mathematics.

title: Under one minute! Gukesh, Carlsen's ultra-short clash wows chess world - Watch
content: In a swift encounter at the Super United Rapid and Blitz Chess Tournament, D Gukesh and Magnus Carlsen played to a quick 14-move draw. This tactical pause came after Gukesh's struggles in the blitz section, contrasting with Carlsen's dominant performance. Carlsen is now in a strong position to secure another title, highlighting the contrasting trajectories of the two chess giants.

title: Clashes erupt in Bihar's Gopalganj, Katihar during Muharram processions
content: Muharram processions in Bihar's Gopalganj and Katihar districts were marred by clashes on Sunday. In Gopalganj's Manjha, a dispute between akharas over stunt performances led to a minor injury. Meanwhile, in Katihar's Naya Tola, stone-pelting and vandalism occurred near a temple during a procession, but authorities quickly brought the situation under control, with no injuries reported.

title: New US duties from August 1 if no deals, says Treasury Secretary
content: The United States is poised to reinstate tariffs on imports from key trading partners, including Taiwan and the European Union, starting August 1 if bilateral trade deals are not finalized by July 9. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent reaffirmed President Trump's plan, emphasizing that countries must secure agreements to avoid the elevated tariffs.

title: MAGA's Laura Loomer predicts 3 key figures joining Musk's America Party
content: Laura Loomer predicts Tucker Carlson, Marjorie Taylor Greene, and Thomas Massie will join Elon Musk's America Party, potentially reshaping the conservative landscape. Loomer suggests Carlson's alignment with Musk offers an alternative to Trump, while Greene's anti-establishment views and Massie's fiscal conservatism align with the party's focus on budget cuts and freedom.

title: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Top 8 mistakes first-time tax filers make
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: First-time income tax filers often make easily avoidable mistakes that can lead to refund delays or scrutiny. Common errors include choosing the wrong ITR form, neglecting to review AIS/TIS and Form 26AS, and failing to report all income sources.

title: 'For better future of Bihar': Chirag Paswan announces candidacy for assembly polls
content: Chirag Paswan, Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) chief and Union Minister, declared his candidacy for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections, vowing to champion the state's future. He pledged to fulfill his father's vision of 'Bihar first, Bihari first' and advocated for a domicile policy in government jobs to benefit the state's youth, a stance differing from other NDA members.

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Victim's brother alleges he too was beaten; hospitalised for exam
content: Naveen Kumar, brother of Ajith Kumar, is in hospital, alleging police brutality. Ajith died in Sivaganga district, reportedly in police custody. A postmortem revealed injuries, suggesting torture. The Tamil Nadu government gave compensation to Ajith's family. Chief Minister MK Stalin has ordered a CBI investigation. Five policemen have been arrested in connection with the case. Actor Vijay met the family.

title: Indians kidnapped in Mali: What are the demands of al-Qaida? Relative narrates ordeal
content: An al-Qaida-linked group in Mali has abducted three Indian nationals, including P Venkataraman from Odisha, and is reportedly demanding ransom for their release. The abduction occurred during an attack on the Diamond Cement Factory, prompting concern from the Ministry of External Affairs. Indian embassy is working closely with Malian authorities to secure the safe return of the abducted workers.

title: India finish second! Harvinder’s double gold leads 9-medal haul at Asian Para C'ship
content: Harvinder Singh dominated the Beijing 2025 Asian Para Archery Championships, securing two gold medals and leading India to second place overall. He set a new competition record in the recurve men's qualifying round. India concluded the competition with a total of nine medals, including three gold, three silver, and three bronze, showcasing a strong performance against top competitors like China.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Leaves Apple and Microsoft behind
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: 'CO, SDM ko lagao pair dabane ke liye': Akhilesh Yadav mocks Yogi government over Kanwar Yatra row
content: Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Uttar Pradesh government's handling of the Kanwar Yatra, suggesting officials should focus on providing food and health services to pilgrims. He mocked the directive for shopkeepers to display names, accusing the government of using QR codes to mask its failure to provide basic facilities like rest areas and food for the yatris.

title: Ohio's 'Fauci': Meet Amy Acton; who is challenging Vivek Ramaswamy for governorship
content: Acton’s childhood reads like a Dickensian nightmare set in Youngstown: parents divorced at three, sexual abuse by her stepfather, a basement below an antique shop for a home, a tent for a winter roof. Yet she rose – accelerated medical programme, public health leadership, compassion burnished by lived trauma. When Republican Governor Mike DeWine, a Bush-era conservative, picked her in 2019 to tackle Ohio’s opioid crisis, neither realised she’d soon lead a war on a silent, mutating enemy.

title: 'I will try to score 200 next time': 14-yo Suryavanshi after scoring fastest hundred - Watch
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, made the fastest century in Youth ODIs. He scored a 52-ball century against England U19. Earlier, he became the youngest T20 centurion in IPL 2025. Suryavanshi now aims to score a double-century in his next match. He was inspired by Shubman Gill's innings at Edgbaston. He wants to bat longer for his team's benefit.

title: Top stocks to buy in upcoming week: Nifty broader trend still bullish
content: Stock market recommendations: Sudeep Shah from SBICAP Securities suggests Chennai Petroleum Corporation and KPR Mill as top stock picks for the week. Nifty ended flat last week, showing market indecision, while Bank Nifty, despite a minor dip, remains bullish.

title: F-35B stranded in Kerala: 25 UK engineers arrive to repair $110 million fighter jet
content: A UK Royal Air Force Airbus A400M arrived in Kerala carrying aviation engineers to repair a stranded British F-35B Lightning fighter jet. The jet made an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport due to an engineering issue. The repair work will be carried out at the airport's MRO facility with support from Indian authorities and the Indian Air Force.

title: Pocket knife, hair clips, and dhoti: Army doctor helps woman deliver baby; mother, child stable
content: While awaiting his train at Jhansi railway station, Major Rohit Bachwala, an army doctor, swiftly aided a pregnant woman in labor using a pocket knife, hair clips, and a dhoti. Railway staff secured the area and provided gloves.

title: Growing in leaps! India GVA could hit $9.82 tn by 2035
content: PwC India's report projects India's GVA to reach $9.82 trillion by 2035, driven by a shift towards addressing core human and industrial needs across nine growth domains. Indian companies can achieve this by embracing inter-sector cooperation and focusing on areas like societal living, movement, and healthcare. Business leaders are adapting to market changes, with many entering new sectors.

title: 'It's time to focus on Mars': Elon Musk wants International Space Station retired
content: Elon Musk wants the International Space Station to shut down. He suggests focusing on Mars missions instead. He thinks the ISS is old and costly. NASA plans to deorbit the ISS by 2030. Some support Musk's Mars vision. Others worry about losing ISS research and partnerships. A gradual shift is a suggested solution. The debate continues.

title: Pune techie rape case: Top cop says 22-year-old woman filed false complaint
content: Pune Police have dismissed a rape allegation made by a 22-year-old data scientist as a fabrication intended to mislead authorities. Commissioner Amitesh Kumar stated the woman's report, claiming assault by a delivery agent, was false. Investigations revealed inconsistencies within 24 hours, including a manipulated selfie and a self-authored threatening message. The man in the selfie was known to her.

title: Rs 1.07 lakh bill: 168 labourers, 65 masons hired to apply 4 litre of paint at school; probe ordered
content: Madhya Pradesh's school education minister has launched an investigation into alleged fraudulent bills from Shahdol district schools. The bills indicated exorbitant labor costs for minimal paint application, with one school reporting 168 laborers for just 4 liters of paint.

title: 2025 Bajaj Dominar 250, Dominar 400 launched
content: Bajaj Auto has launched the 2025 versions of its Dominar 400 and 250 sports tourers. The Dominar 400, priced at Rs 2.38 lakh, now features ride-by-wire technology with four riding modes. The Dominar 250, costing Rs 1.92 lakh, offers selectable ABS modes. Both models sport a new LCD speedometer and reworked handlebar positioning for enhanced comfort.

title: 'People will ask if Shubman Gill trusts his attack': Ex-England captain
content: Nasser Hussain believes India faces pressure to secure a win on Day 5 against England in the second Test, questioning Shubman Gill's trust in his bowlers if they fail. Mark Butcher suggests a draw would be a moral victory for England, fueled by India's late declaration, urging them to seize the opportunity and entertain fans with a resilient performance.

title: Electoral roll revision: Lakhs in Bihar may lose vote, ADR tells SC
content: The Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) has challenged the Election Commission's special intensive revision (SIR) of Bihar's electoral rolls in the Supreme Court, arguing it could disenfranchise lakhs, particularly from marginalized communities. ADR contends the SIR's documentation requirements disproportionately affect vulnerable populations, as Aadhaar and ration cards are not accepted.

title: Lathi Charge, Case Against 16 After Attempt To Divert Muharram Procession Route In Ujjain
content: Tensions flared during a Muharram procession in Ujjain's Begumbagh area when a group of men allegedly broke police barricades and attempted to divert the religious procession from its pre-approved route.

title: Hezbollah Chief Says Won't Surrender Under Israeli Threats
content: Hezbollah leader Naim Qassem said his group would not surrender or lay down its weapons in response to Israeli threats, despite pressure on the Lebanese militants to disarm.

title: 4 Killed, 1 injured As Alto Car Falls Into Gorge In Manali: Police
content: Four people, including two tourists from Punjab, were killed on the spot, while one person sustained critical injuries when their vehicle skidded off a road and fell into a gorge near the Rani nallah.

title: Bihar Opposition Party RJD Challenges Poll Roll Revision In Supreme Court
content: RJD approached the Supreme Court challenging the Election Commission order on revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, which is set to go to polls later this year.

title: Chirag Paswan Attacks BJP-Led Alliance Over Businessman's Murder In Bihar
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan has strongly criticised the Bihar government led by his ally, Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, over the murder of a prominent businessman in the state capital Patna.

title: Video Shows Land Disappear Within Minutes In Devastating Texas Floods
content: Rescuers searched Saturday for 27 missing girls who were swept away by devastating floods in Central Texas of United States, as the death toll jumped over 50, with the likelihood of finding more survivors appearing to diminish.

title: All About UAE's New Golden Visa For Indians: Eligibility, Perks And More
content: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has made the 10-year residency more accessible to professionals across sectors.

title: Rename New Delhi Railway Station After Atal Bihari Vajpayee: BJP MP
content: BJP Lok Sabha member Praveen Khandelwal on Sunday shot off a letter to Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, requesting him to rename New Delhi Railway Station after former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

title: Electoral Roll Revision: Mahua Moitra Says Bengal Is Next Target, Moves Court
content: TMC MP Mahua Moitra alleged that EC's order for electoral rolls' revision in Bihar was intended to deprive the bonafide young electorate from voting in this year's polling, and the panel's next target is West Bengal.

title: Finally, Indian Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla Inside Iconic Cupola Of International Space Station
content: Axiom Space says the crew - commander Peggy Whitson, pilot Shubhanshu "Shux" Shukla, and mission specialists Slawosz "Suave" Uznanski-Wisniewski and Tibor Kapu - have now completed nine productive days aboard the ISS.

title: How Jesse, The Sniffer Dog, Cracked Murder Case, Rescued Kidnapped Child In Mumbai
content: A German Shepherd named Jesse has become a key member of the Mumbai Police's K9 squad, helping solve multiple high-profile cases involving murder, robbery, and kidnapping.

title: Dalit Youth Assaulted, Paraded Half-Naked In Punjab Village, 1 Arrested: Cops
content: A young Dalit man was assaulted and paraded half-naked with his face forcibly shaved and blackened after his friend eloped with a woman in a village here, police said on Sunday.

title: Marathi Medium Helped My Conceptual Understanding In School: Chief Justice BR Gavai
content: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai turned emotional on recalling the moment he fulfilled his father's dream by becoming a judge and also highlighted on Sunday the benefits of studying in his Marathi mother tongue.

title: Angry Parents Beat Bihar School Teacher Blue And Black After He Slaps Child
content: Angry parents barged into a school in Bihar's Gaya district, created a ruckus and beat up a teacher who had allegedly slapped their child.

title: Devendra Fadnavis Launches Podcast, Urges People To Preserve Legacy Of State Icons
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday appealed to citizens to preserve and nurture the knowledge shared by the state's saints and icons, calling it a responsibility.

title: China's Xi Jinping To Miss BRICS Summit For First Time. Here's Why
content: The 17th BRICS Summit kicked off on Sunday in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro, bringing together leaders from major emerging economies--but without the attendance of one of the top leaders of one of its most powerful members.

title: PM Modi Arrives At Rio Museum To Attend BRICS Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome from President of Brazil Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva as he arrived at the Museum of Modern Art in Rio de Janeiro to attend the 17th BRICS Leaders Summit.

title: "What's The Difference?" BJP Leader's Religion-Language Remark Amid Slapgate
content: BJP leader and Maharashtra minister Ashish Shelar has compared the violence on non-Marathi speaking migrants in Maharashtra with the Pahalgam terror attack, as the language row emerged as a major political flashpoint ahead of local body elections

title: Pakistan Building Collapse Death Count Jumps To 27
content: The death count in the building collapse in Pakistan's southern port city of Karachi has jumped to 27 as rescuers retrieved more bodies, a spokesperson of the state-owned rescue organization Rescue 1122 said on Sunday.

title: 78 Dead Since Onset Of Monsoon In Himachal Pradesh
content: At least 78 people have lost their lives in Himachal Pradesh since the onset of the monsoon on June 20, according to the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA).
